page.title: 03Farming
page.content: Although animal farming constitutes only a small proportion of the overall farming in the area, many farms do raise animals as a side-line. We found sheep, goats, turkeys, and horses as well as the more common cattle. One interesting farm is devoted to free-range chicken production where hundreds of chickens live freely in chicken houses on a hillside. (See slide). There is a market held in Cock Clarks itself for the sale and purchase of farm animals. Although farming is so important to the area, we were surprised at how many derelict farms and buildings on farmland we found.
